sentences.text: This summary provides highlights from our Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended December 31, 2016,  as filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) on February 6, 2017 (the 2016 Form 10-K), and from  our Fourth-Quarter Earnings Presentation, filed with the SEC on Form 8-K on January 25, 2017 (the 2017 Form 8-K),  to assist you in reviewing Norfolk Southerns 2016 performance.

sentences.text: The information contained below is only a summary,  and you should refer to the more comprehensive discussions contained in our 2016 Form 10-K, as supplemented by our  Form 8-Ks filed during 2017, for additional information about these highlights.

sentences.text: 2016 was a pivotal year as we began implementing our new strategic plan to reduce costs, drive profitability and  accelerate growth.

sentences.text: STRATEGIC PLAN TO INCREASE SHAREHOLDER VALUE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Key Focus Areas Key Financial Targets 2016 2020 Optimize revenue  both pricing and volume Disciplined pricing increases above rail inflation Improve productivity to deliver efficient and  superior service   Operating Ratio < 70 Operating Ratio < 65 Increase asset utilization Double-digit compound annual EPS growth by 2020 Focus capital investment to support long-term  value creation   CapEx ~19% of revenue CapEx ~17% of revenue Reward shareholders with significant return  of capital   Dividend payout target of ~33% over the longer  term and continuation of dividend growth and  significant share repurchases
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are on track to achieve our 2020 goals, and we expect to achieve $650 million in annual productivity savings by  the end of the five-year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are well positioned for growth and have the flexibility to align resources and service  capabilities with demand.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are steadfast in our commitment to meet evolving customer expectations, supporting long- term growth and increased shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board and management team are confident that this strategic plan will build long-term, sustainable value  for all of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We delivered $250 million in productivity savings and recorded our best ever operating ratio of 68.9 percent for 2016,  Jim Squires first fiscal year as CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These results were achieved despite overall volume declines of 3 percent, a  weak commodity market and a continuation of significant adverse changes in NS traffic mix.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even in the face of this  difficult economic environment, we achieved the 2016 targets of our strategic plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While revenues were 6% lower than  2015, our focus on cost control and asset utilization allowed us to lower expenses by 11%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Diluted earnings per share  ncreased 10% to $5.62 compared with $5.10 per diluted share in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We achieved improvements in service, and our network fluidity increased.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our composite service metric rose to above  80% for the year as compared to 72% in 2015, an 11% improvement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our train speed increased by 9% for the year, and  terminal dwell time improved by 7% for the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We achieved this high level of performance while accomplishing strategic  network and organizational changes.

sentences.text: DIRECTOR INDEPENDENCE The Board of Directors has considered whether the members of our Board of Directors are independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A director is  considered independent if the Board determines that the director has no material relationship with Norfolk Southern  (directly or as a partner, shareholder or officer of an organization that has a relationship with Norfolk Southern).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The  Board makes these determinations after full deliberation, considering all relevant facts and circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To aid in its  evaluation of director independence, the Board has adopted categorical independence standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the standards,  an individual director is independent, unless the Board determines otherwise, if none of the following relationships exists  between Norfolk Southern and the director:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the director is, or has been within the last three years, an employee, or an immediate family member of the  director is, or has been within the last three years, an Executive Officer, of Norfolk Southern or any of our  consolidated subsidiaries;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the director or an immediate family member of the director has received during any twelve-month period within  the last three years more than $120,000 in direct compensation from Norfolk Southern or any of our consolidated  subsidiaries, other than director and committee fees and deferred compensation for prior service (provided such  deferred compensation is not contingent in any way on continued service);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) the director is a current partner or employee of a present or former internal or external auditor of Norfolk Southern  or any of our consolidated subsidiaries,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) the director has an immediate family member who is a current partner  of such a firm,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) the director has an immediate family member who is a current employee of such a firm and  personally works on Norfolk Southerns audit, or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) the director or an immediate family member was within the last  three years a partner or employee of such a firm and personally worked on Norfolk Southerns audit within that time;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the director or an immediate family member is, or has been within the last three years, employed as an executive officer of another company where one of our Executive Officers serves as a director and sits on that companys  compensation committee;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the director is an executive officer or employee, or an immediate family member of the director is an executive officer,  of a company that makes payments to, or receives payments from, Norfolk Southern or any of our consolidated  subsidiaries for property or services in an amount which, in any of the last three fiscal years, exceeds the greater of  $1 million or 2% of such other companys consolidated gross revenues; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the director is an executive officer or compensated employee, or an immediate family member of the director is an  executive officer, of a charitable organization that receives donations from Norfolk Southern, any of our consolidated  subsidiaries or the Norfolk Southern Foundation in an amount which, in any of the last three fiscal years, exceeds  the greater of $1 million or 2% of such charitable organizations donations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of these categorical standards, immediate family member has the definition used in the New York  Stock Exchanges Listing Standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These categorical independence standards are available on our website at  www.nscorp.com on the Invest in NS page under Governance Documents.

sentences.text: ANNUAL INCENTIVE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of our Named Executive Officers participates in Norfolk Southerns Executive Management Incentive Plan (EMIP),  which is designed to compensate executives based on achievement of annual corporate performance goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year,  the Compensation Committee establishes a maximum opportunity for each Named Executive Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The maximum  opportunity is determined using relevant market data and internal pay equity, and is expressed as a percentage of  base salary:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the Committee established a maximum opportunity for the Chief Executive Officer of 250% of base salary and  a maximum opportunity for each of the Executive Vice Presidents of 145% of his or her base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The maximum annual  incentive award that each Named Executive Officer is eligible to receive is not the amount expected to be paid to an  executive, but is instead the highest amount that the Committee may award as performance-based compensation while  preserving deductibility under Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has no discretion to increase  the payout above the maximum opportunity under the EMIP .
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee chose these maximum opportunities to  permit flexibility in the event of unusual and exceptional circumstances, and its expectation, absent such circumstances,  was to approve payouts that correspond to a 225% opportunity for the Chief Executive Officer and a 135% opportunity  for Executive Vice Presidents to align more closely with market pay positions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described earlier, the Committee  established performance targets which, if met, would result in payments equal to 146% and 88%, respectively (which  equals in each case 65% of the respective annual incentive opportunity).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may reduce the annual incentive paid to any executive based on performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the Committee  did not make any adjustments to the annual incentive payout based on individual performance, and approved payouts  to Mr. Squires based on a 225% opportunity and to the Executive Vice presidents based on a 135% opportunity.

sentences.text: The  annual incentive amounts paid for 2016 and reported as Non-Equity Incentive Plan Compensation in the Summary  Compensation Table are based on the formula described below applied to these opportunities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under EMIP , each participant has an opportunity to earn an annual incentive that is determined by Norfolk Southerns  performance relative to goals established by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Committee established goals for operating  income, operating ratio, and the composite service measure, weighted 50%, 35% and 15% respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee selected operating income, consisting of operating revenue less the sum of operating expenses, as a  measure of the corporations financial profitability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Operating ratio, or operating expenses as a percentage of revenue, is a  measure of operational efficiency.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The composite service measure is the weighted average of train performance, connection performance, and adherence  to operating plan, with weights of 40%, 30% and 30% respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each measure is based on objective performance  targets, and the composite service measure is based on goals for each of the three individual service measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The  composite service measure is an indication of the overall performance of our rail network and reflects service performance to our customers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These measures are used operationally by management and are highly visible to our employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a  result, the Committee selected these three service measures as the best available internal standard to evaluate Norfolk  Southerns overall customer service performance.

sentences.text: VOTING AND PROXIES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This proxy statement and the proxy card relate to the Board of Directors solicitation of your proxy for use at our Annual  Meeting of Shareholders to be held on May 11, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following questions and answers provide guidance on how to  vote your shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: WE WANT TO HEAR FROM YOU  VOTE TODAY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Who can vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders who are record owners of our common stock as of the close of business on March 2, 2017, are entitled to  notice of and to vote at the 2017 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of the close of business on the Tuesday, March 2, 2017, record date, 310,713,904 shares of our common stock were  issued and outstanding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Of those shares, 290,393,127 shares were owned by shareholders entitled to one vote per  share.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The remaining 20,320,777 shares were held by our wholly owned subsidiaries, which are not entitled to vote those  shares under Virginia law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders will be voting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) to elect directors of Norfolk Southern (Item 1);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) to ratify the appointment of KPMG as our  independent auditors (Item 2);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) on an advisory basis, on executive compensation as disclosed in the Compensation  Discussion and Analysis, the Summary Compensation Table and other related tables and disclosures in this proxy  statement (Item 3); and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) the frequency of advisory resolution on executive compensation (Item 4).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Item 3 and Item 4 are being provided as required by Section 14A of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors is recommending that shareholders vote FOR Items 1, 2, and 3, and ONE YEAR on Item 4.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How will these matters be decided at the Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you sign and return the proxy card without specifying your vote on a particular voting item, your shares will be voted in  accordance with the Board Recommendation unless you revoke your proxy before the shares are voted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have a majority voting standard for election of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director nominee who receives a majority of the  votes cast will be elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any current director who does not meet this standard must, pursuant to our Bylaws, promptly  tender resignation to the Board of Directors for consideration by our Governance and Nominating Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How many shares are needed at the Annual Meeting to constitute a quorum?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The presence, either in person or by proxy, of the holders of a majority of the outstanding shares of our common stock  entitled to vote at the 2017 Annual Meeting is necessary to constitute a quorum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions and broker non-votes are  counted as present and entitled to vote for purposes of determining a quorum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Who is soliciting my proxy?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors is soliciting your proxy to vote your shares at the 2017 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you give the Board of Directors your proxy, your shares will be voted in accordance with the selections you indicate on the proxy card.

sentences.text: Who is paying for this solicitation?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Norfolk Southern pays the cost of preparing proxy materials and soliciting proxies, including the reimbursement, upon  request, of trustees, brokerage firms, banks and other nominee record holders for the reasonable expenses they incur  to forward proxy materials to beneficial owners.

sentences.text: Our officers and other employees may solicit proxies by telephone,  facsimile, electronic mail or personal interview; they receive no additional compensation for doing so.

sentences.text: We have retained  Innisfree M&A Incorporated to assist in the solicitation of proxies at an anticipated cost of $17,500, plus reasonable out- of-pocket expenses.

sentences.text: What is the difference between holding shares as a shareholder of record and as a beneficial owner?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your shares are registered directly in your name with our transfer agent, American Stock Transfer and Trust Company,  you are considered a shareholder of record with respect to those shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your shares are held in a brokerage account  or bank, broker or other nominee, you are considered the beneficial owner of such shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How do I vote if I am a shareholder of record?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are the record owner of any shares of our common stock (the shares are registered in your name), you may vote your shares by submitting the proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You also may vote by telephone or the Internet in the manner described on the proxy card or Notice, or you may  vote by marking, dating and signing the proxy card and mailing it to American Stock Transfer and Trust Company  Shareholder Services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may also vote in person by ballot at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How do I vote if I am a beneficial owner of the shares?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are the beneficial owner of any shares (the shares are held in street name by a broker, bank or other nominee), you  may vote your shares by submitting your voting instructions to that entity on the voting instruction card included with  these materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You can only vote in person at the Annual Meeting if you bring a legal proxy from the record holder (the  broker, bank or other nominee who holds your shares) assigning its voting authority to you.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares held in street name by a broker may be voted on certain matters even if you do not provide the record holder  with voting instructions; brokers have the authority under New York Stock Exchange Listing Standards to vote shares for  which their customers do not provide voting instructions on certain routine matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ratification of the appointment  of KPMG LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm (Item 2) is considered a routine matter for which  brokers may vote shares they hold in street name, even in the absence of voting instructions from the beneficial owner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The election of directors (Item 1), approval of advisory resolution on executive compensation (Item 3), and the frequency  of advisory resolution on executive compensation (Item 4) are not considered routine matters, and a broker cannot vote  shares it holds in street name on these proposals if it has not received voting instructions from the beneficial owner of the  shares with respect to the proposals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How do I vote if I own common stock through an employee plan?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If shares are credited to your account in the Norfolk Southern Corporation Thoroughbred Retirement Investment Plan  or the Thrift and Investment Plan, you will receive an instruction form from the trustee of that plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your instruction form  submitted by mail, over the telephone or Internet serves as voting instructions for the trustee of the plans, Vanguard  Fiduciary Trust Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your instruction is not received by the trustee by 11:59 P .
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: M.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eastern Time on May 8, 2017,  the trustee of these plans will vote your shares for each item on the proxy card in the same proportion as the shares that  are voted for that item by the other participants in the respective plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employee plan participants may vote their plan  shares only through the trustee and may not vote their plan shares in person at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What if I change my mind after I vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any shareholder of record may revoke a previously submitted proxy at any time before the shares are voted by:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) giving  written notice of revocation to our Corporate Secretary;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) submitting subsequent voting instructions over the telephone  or the Internet;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) delivering a validly completed proxy card bearing a later date; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) attending the 2017 Annual Meeting  and voting in person.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For shares you hold beneficially in street name, you may change your vote by submitting new voting  instructions to your broker, bank or other nominee, or, if you have obtained a legal proxy from your broker, bank or other  nominee giving you the right to vote your shares, by attending the 2017 Annual Meeting and voting in person.

sentences.text: In addition, each Inspector of Election will have  taken the oath required by Virginia law to execute duties faithfully and impartially.
